post.body_html:
Hello World Here is the list of ... 1, 2, 3...

Yes, 6 useful resources for you to learn math!

üîñ - Bookmark the article to save it and remember the like ‚ù§Ô∏è and maybe super likeü¶Ñ

You absolutely need to read that:

250+ JS Resources to Master Programming üí• Cheat Sheet

DevLorenzo „Éª Apr 20 „Éª 19 min read

#javascript #webdev #productivity #beginners

Hey, remember to follow us!

1) Khan academy

The most complete course path you can find online, from kindergarten to differential algebra.

2) The EDx Math courses

Not really a course path, but a list of tons of useful courses in all the application fields about math.

3) IXL Math Courses

Work in grades and skills. You have a list of exercises for each skill.

4) I practice Math

Courses organized in grade and then in subjects. More focused on exercises.

5) School Yourself

Lots of lessons (videos) based on subjects.

6) Essentials of Linear Algebra - Youtube

An incredible animated series about linear algebra, you will understand all the basics of algebra, in no time!

I hope they will help you improve, but if math makes you like that every time...

Just give up, and focus on programming!

post.body_markdown:
Hello World` Here is the list of ... 1, 2, 3...

![image](https://dev-to-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/articles/bnj6eenc5d7jlvo8odbx.png)

Yes, 6 useful resources for you to learn math!

üîñ - Bookmark the article to save it *and* **remember the like ‚ù§Ô∏è and maybe super likeü¶Ñ**

You absolutely need to read that:
{% link https://dev.to/devlorenzo/200-js-resources-to-master-programming-3aj6 %}

Hey, remember to follow us!

## 1) [Khan academy](https://www.khanacademy.org/math)

![image](https://dev-to-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/articles/5yts2ewgvlqvqm528m0p.png)

The most complete course path you can find online, from kindergarten to differential algebra.

---

## 2) [The EDx Math courses](https://www.edx.org/course/subject/math)

![image](https://dev-to-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/articles/i0k40tvy9nfwon3bi0as.png)

Not really a course path, but a list of tons of useful courses in all the application fields about math. 

---

## 3) [IXL Math Courses](https://www.ixl.com/math/)

![image](https://dev-to-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/articles/hloj3dtllg16chs791dc.png)

Work in grades and skills. You have a list of exercises for each skill. 

---

## 4) [I practice Math](https://www.ipracticemath.com/learn)

![image](https://dev-to-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/articles/acm0bkmtrimv0dqey7q8.png)
 
Courses organized in grade and then in subjects. More focused on exercises. 

---

## 5) [School Yourself](https://schoolyourself.org/)

![image](https://dev-to-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/articles/03znsolyr1fmsolf8ty8.png)

Lots of lessons (videos) based on subjects.

---

## 6) [Essentials of Linear Algebra - Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZHQObOWTQDPD3MizzM2xVFitgF8hE_ab)

An incredible animated series about linear algebra, you will understand all the basics of algebra, in no time!

---

I hope they will help you improve, but if math makes you like that every time...

![image](https://dev-to-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/articles/afaqsil6k58jtuo6oqen.png)
 
Just give up, and focus on programming!

---
